parts.title: Introduction and Interview
parts.instructions: The examiner asks general questions about the candidate.

questions.question: Can you tell me your full name, please?
Do you work or are you a student?
What do you enjoy most about your work or studies?
What is a typical day like for you?
Has your hometown changed in recent years?

parts.title: Long Turn (Cue Card)
parts.instructions: The candidate speaks for 1â€“2 minutes after 1 minute of preparation.

cueCard.topic: Describe a person you know who is very creative.
prompts: and explain why you think this person is creative

parts.title: Discussion
parts.instructions: The examiner asks deeper questions related to Part 2 topic.

questions.question: Do you think creativity is important in everyday life? Why?
Are people today more creative than in the past?
Should schools encourage students to be more creative?
Which school subjects help develop creativity the most?
How important is creativity in modern workplaces?
Does technology help or limit creativity?
